resources.string: About app
Drawing objects
Moving objects
Connecting objects
Controlling frames
Watching animation
Saving results

Stickman application will help you easily create simple animations, like those that almost everyone tried to draw in her notebook. Besides drawing, you can save your animation for future usage and watch it whenever you want.
To draw an object, first choose drawing mode by clicking this button in top menu. Not more than 15 objects can be drawn on a single frame.
You can draw two types of objects: sticks and circles, like on the picture below:

Now you can touch the screen in arbitrary point inside the drawing field (black box, bounding almost all the screen) and drag your finger to another arbitrary point on the screen. You will see a red and gray lines appearing: red line indicates result primitive, which will be drawn if you pull off your finger. Gray line indicates current path of your finger. If your path has self-intersections, a circle will be drawn, else you will get stick. Below you an see an example of what you can see while drawing an object.
Notice, that all the objects you have drawn on the current frame, will appear on all frames after the current one.
To move objects, first choose moving mode by clicking this button in top menu.
You can move objects in two different ways: drag or rotate them. Also, you can scale objects (see below).
To drag an object, touch it\'s black part (not joint, but line) and drag wherever you want. When touched for dragging, objects\'s line colour turns to violet.

To rotate an object, touch it\'s joint and move your finger over the screen. When touched for rotating, objects\'s joint colour turns to violet. Rotation is performed around green blinking joint (it will appear when any joint is touched). Usually it is the green joint of the hierarchy, but if you try to rotate object touching the green joint itself, the rotation will be performed around parent object\'s centre.
To scale an object, quickly tap twice any of it\'s joints, and then drag. When touched for scaling, object\'s joint colour turns to blue.

To remove object from the frame, simply move it so that any of it\'s points gets out of drawing field. After that object will turn to red, and if you pull of your finger, it will be removed from the screen.
To connect objects, first choose moving mode by clicking this button in top menu.
Connected objects form a hierarchy: attached object becomes a child of object, to which it is attached (the latter object becomes parent for the former).

We call object\'s joint a root joint, if touching any other joint in hierarchy causes rotation around this one. Such joint has a green colour and it is always unique and present in any hierarchy. Root joint always belongs to a parent og the hierarchy. We call object\'s joint a free joint, if it\'s not connected with any other joint. free jints (except maybe a root joint) have yellow colour. We call object\'s joint a connected joint, if it\'s connected with some other joint. Connected joints have orange colour.

Key thing is that you can only attach parent objects. To attach one object (parent object!) to any other object, move first object so that one of it\'s free joints overlaps with some joint of second object. After connection, the object you moved becomes child of an object, that was stationary. Note, that object cannot be attached to any of it\'s direct or indirect children.

You can turn any object in hierarchy into parent of this hierarchy by quickly tapping twice on one of it\'s joints or on it\'s line. Note that tapping twice on joint also turns it into new rotation centre of hierarchy.

When parent object is moved, all it\'s children are also moved. On the other hand, you can\'t drag child object explicitly, you can rather rotate it around connection joint or disconnect it from parent by dragging it rather fast.
Note, that you can scale object, only if it\'s absolutely free, i.e. is not a parent nor a child.
As mentioned above, to disconnect objects, quickly pull child object away from parent.
There are four buttons in top menu to control frames (the third is New frame button, and the right most is Delete frame button).
Left and right arrows simply allow you to switch between frames. Also under the top menu there is a seekbar that allows rapid navigation, and frame counter on the right of it.

Pressing New frame button you can add frames to your animation. Notice that new frames will appear right after the current frame, and will contain all the objects from the current frame you have drawn so far.

Pressing Delete frame button you can remove current frame. Notice, that if you have only one frame, removing it equivalent to clearing the frame, yet it will be still present (animation can\'t has less than one frame).
To play animation you have created, push Play button in top menu.
To stop playing animation, push the same button (it has become red after playing had started).
You can change animation speed in settings choosing animation frames per second (FPS). Settings are available from the bottom menu.
Notice that you can\'t draw or move objects while watching animation.
To save or load animation, go to bottom menu and select appropriate item.
